glsa.title: PeerCast: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in PeerCast may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: PeerCast is a client and server for P2P-radio networks.

description.p: Nico Golde reported a boundary error in the HTTP::getAuthUserPass() function when processing overly long HTTP Basic authentication requests.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted HTTP request to the vulnerable server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PeerCast users should upgrade to the latest version:
